bwwExcerpt: To say that Guingona is brilliant in the role of Rothko is an understatement, and that is really a failure at finding the right words for this portrayal. Last year, in "Next Fall" I had wondered why I wasn't seeing more of Guingona in theater. Kicking off the year with "Red" made it worth the wait. "Red" resonates in the context of third world Philippines with with its travesties of art and culture, creativity and artmaking.
